III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of
Description administrative, supervisory, social service, direct care,
1

and other staff on duty to perform the prescribed
functions required by these administrative rules and in the
agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Therapist 1 provided vapes and her personal cell phone to Youth
A for their use while Youth A was placed at the facility.
Investigation The complainant was contacted on 09/04/2025 and had no
additional information to provide.
Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1 over the phone on
08/26/2025. She confirmed Therapist 1 worked with her while
Youth A had previously been placed at the facility. She denied the
allegations that Therapist 1 had ever provided a vape to her or let
her use Therapist 1’s personal cell phone. Youth A was not sure if
Therapist 1 even used a vape recreationally while away from
youth but stated she had never seen her with one. Youth A
recalled Therapist 1 using her work computer with Youth A before
and after sessions for purposes related to Youth A’s progress in
the program. Youth A did not recall Therapist 1 ever doing
anything inappropriate while in sessions with Youth A.
Therapist 1 was interviewed over the phone on 9/12/25. Therapist
1 denied ever providing a vape pen to Youth A. She denied using
a vape pen personally and stated that she had never had one on
her person or in her office with any youth at the
program. Therapist 1 confirmed she had worked with Youth A and
many other youths individually. She stated that she had never
provided her phone to Youth A. Therapist 1 stated that she would
use her computer with Youth A, and other youth, as a part of the
programming offered by the program but denied that this was ever
done so personally or inappropriately.
Documentation reviewed:
• Facility policy & procedures titled “Personal Involvement
with Children” were provided and reviewed. This policy
required staff to “at all times maintain a professional
relationship with the children in care.”
• Personnel documentation for Therapist 1 was reviewed and
it was confirmed she had no discipline in her file since her
date of hire on 09/30/2024. She was last trained in the
2

facility “Personal Involvement with Children” policy on
02/19/2025.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as per youth and staff
interviews and documentation reviewed there was no evidence
found that Therapist 1 provided Youth A with a vape pen or her
personal cell phone for inappropriate use.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
